    The main class for the CS410J Phone Bill Project

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static void checkDate​(String[] args, String arg, String name)
      Test date format Valid : MM/DD/YYYY - Must be using "/" to separate the values - Month and Day needs to be 1 or 2 digits - Year needs to be 4 digits only - Month needs to be between 1 and 12 - Day needs to be between 1 and 31 - Should only have month, day, and year and no more
      static void checkDateFormat​(String args, String name)
      Check if the starting/ending date format is separated via "/"
      static void checkInt​(String[] args, String name)
      Go through all the String that has been split to check if all of them are integer
      static void checkNumberFormat​(String args, String name)
      Check if the caller/callee number format is separated via "-" and has 3 section
      static void checkTime​(String[] args, String arg, String name)
      Check time format Valid : HH:MM - Must be using ":" to separate the values - Hour and Min should be the only input - Hour and Min is 1 or 2 digits - Hour needs to be between 0 and 23 - Min needs to be between 0 and 59
      static void checkTimeFormat​(String args, String name)
      Check if the starting/ending time format is separated via ":"
      static boolean isInt​(String input)
      Checks if the String is integer
      static void main​(String[] args)  
      static void parseInput​(PhoneCall calling, PhoneBill billing, String[] args, int i)
      Parses the command line argument and initialize the PhoneCall field and add it to the PhoneBill field Argument in order of - Customer Name - Caller Number - Callee Number - Starting Date - Starting Time - Ending Date - Ending Time

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        Parameters:

      • checkInt

        public static void checkInt​(String[] args,
                            String name)
        Go through all the String that has been split to check if all of them are integer
        Parameters:
        args - String array that was split from command line
        name - Name of the format

      • checkDate

        public static void checkDate​(String[] args,
                             String arg,
                             String name)
        Test date format Valid : MM/DD/YYYY - Must be using "/" to separate the values - Month and Day needs to be 1 or 2 digits - Year needs to be 4 digits only - Month needs to be between 1 and 12 - Day needs to be between 1 and 31 - Should only have month, day, and year and no more
        Parameters:
        args - String array which was split from command line
        arg - Corresponding command line argument
        name - Name of the format

      • checkTime

        public static void checkTime​(String[] args,
                             String arg,
                             String name)
        Check time format Valid : HH:MM - Must be using ":" to separate the values - Hour and Min should be the only input - Hour and Min is 1 or 2 digits - Hour needs to be between 0 and 23 - Min needs to be between 0 and 59
        Parameters:
        args - String array split from the command line
        arg - Corresponding command line argument
        name - Name of the format

      • checkNumberFormat

        public static void checkNumberFormat​(String args,
                                     String name)
        Check if the caller/callee number format is separated via "-" and has 3 section
        Parameters:
        args - String from command line argument
        name - Name of the format

      • checkDateFormat

        public static void checkDateFormat​(String args,
                                   String name)
        Check if the starting/ending date format is separated via "/"
        Parameters:
        args - String from command line argument
        name - Name of the format

      • checkTimeFormat

        public static void checkTimeFormat​(String args,
                                   String name)
        Check if the starting/ending time format is separated via ":"
        Parameters:
        args - String from command line argument
        name - Name of the format

      • parseInput

        public static void parseInput​(PhoneCall calling,
                              PhoneBill billing,
                              String[] args,
                              int i)
        Parses the command line argument and initialize the PhoneCall field and add it to the PhoneBill field Argument in order of - Customer Name - Caller Number - Callee Number - Starting Date - Starting Time - Ending Date - Ending Time
        Parameters:
        calling - PhoneCall field for the command line input
        billing - PhoneBill field for Customer name and PhoneCall field
        args - Command line argument
        i - Option buffer
